Subjects: chansons d’aventure ; May, poems of; carols, amorous
_description: The beginning of a chanson d’aventure of a man in black — three 6-line tail-rhyme stanzas and burden: ‘Wep no more ffor me swet hart / Wepe no more for me / As scharpe as a dart hathe perysht my hart / That ye shod morne for me’

BLHar1317.First Lines:
Apon a mornyng of mayIn the mornyng greyI walkyd
                    plesantly…
BLHar1317.Last Lines:
…Hys gown al blakeApon hys bakeLyke lede hys colore
                    was
BLHar1317.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 2.39.
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 312; 1977, 281-2.
